byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Benjamin Mueller, Marc Santora, Nate Schweber, Jeffrey E. Singer and Vivian Yee.
byline.original: By AL BAKER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

abstract: Officials say New York City Police Officer Peter Liang, who fatally shot unarmed black man Akai Gurley in Brooklyn public housing complex in November 2014, has been indicted by grand jury on charges that include second-degree manslaughter; reform advocates and some elected officials welcome news of indictment.
lead_paragraph: The indictment against Officer Peter Liang, who shot the unarmed 28-year-old in Brooklyn last year, includes one count of manslaughter and one count of criminally negligent homicide, an official said.

headline.main: New York City Police Officer Is Said to Be Indicted in Shooting Death of Akai Gurley
headline.print_headline: Officer Is Said to Be Indicted in Man’s Death

snippet: The indictment against Officer Peter Liang, who shot the unarmed 28-year-old in Brooklyn last year, includes one count of manslaughter and one count of criminally negligent homicide, an official said.
